mm.issues.provider

Class GitHubIssueProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • mm.issues.provider.GitHubIssueProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IssueProvider

    public class GitHubIssueProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements IssueProvider
    class GitHubIssueProvider leverages jcabi to access and use the GitHub version 3 API.

    jcabi is open source, available from GitHub and takes care of the heavy lifting for executing the GitHub APIs.

    Using it will allow this use case to embrace change. Starting simple and later security can be added with additional functionality to create and update and act on issues by both humans and machines.

    If the need to access additional resources for issues then the pattern implemented supports additional providers by just supplying a new Provider. For example class CodeCommitProvider, a potential provider for CodeCommit is AWS's "git" repository.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    markmorris

      IssueResponse searchForIssues(java.lang.String repoName)
      searchForIssues will access GitHub using the third-party library provided by open source JCABI.

      It builds up the URL and then fetches the results.

      GitHub states it limits the returned issues to 1000 per repository even though the program is able to fetch more than 1000 for a repository.

    • Method Detail

      • searchForIssues

        public IssueResponse searchForIssues(java.lang.String repoName)
        searchForIssues will access GitHub using the third-party library provided by open source JCABI.

        It builds up the URL and then fetches the results.

        GitHub states it limits the returned issues to 1000 per repository even though the program is able to fetch more than 1000 for a repository. GitHub returns a last page indicator in the headers. We use this header to retrieve all the issue pages.

        This operation is running in it's own thread, concurrently executing with additional operations retrieving repositories.

        Ideally, the task of downloading the pages can also be performed async concurrently, but for now we will retrieve them one by one. But each repository is async concurrently fetched. And within each thread the pages are fetched. This page fetching could also be concurrent but the rate limit defeats the benefit.

        If rate limiting was not an restriction then the processing of fetching could be distributed across many machines, and aggregating can also be spread across a decreasing number of machines until one assembles the final two to merge.

        TODO: the exception handling needs more treatment to capture and understand what may go wrong in the GitHub response. Using a new library and third-party data source API does bring benefit and risk, so trapping all errors is critical. Currently, we trap exceptions, but a finer granularity is needed for production.

        Specified by:
        searchForIssues in interface IssueProvider
        Parameters:
        repoName - String representing the owner and repository as owner/repo_name
        Returns:
        IssueResponse of JsonObjects each representing an issue for the repository

      • getGitHubApi

        private com.jcabi.github.Github getGitHubApi(java.lang.String username,
                                             java.lang.String password)
        getGitHubApi creates the object to access GitHub API. If username and password are found in the environment then username and password will use them to return an authenticated object for accessing GitHub. An authenticated object will increase the GitHub rate limit from 10 to 30.
        Parameters:
        username - is your GitHub username if the environment variable GITHUB_ISSUES_USERNAME is set
        password - is your GitHub password if the environment variable GITHUB_ISSUES_PASSWORD is set
        Returns:
        GitHub the GitHub object to access GitHub API

      • fetch

        private com.jcabi.http.Response fetch(com.jcabi.http.Request request)
        fetch executes the request
        Parameters:
        request - is the search request for GitHub
        Returns:
        Response is object returned from the fetch. It encapsulates the HTTP JSON response from GitHub.

      • extractLastPage

        private java.lang.String extractLastPage(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> headers)
        extractLastPage operation gets the lastpage indicator from the response headers. lastpage indicates how many issues are available for a repository. The program uses the lastpage variable to loop through and fetch all issues up to and including the lastpage of issues.
        Parameters:
        headers - from the response
        Returns:
        String representing the last available page of issues for the repository

      • createRequest

        private com.jcabi.http.Request createRequest(java.lang.String repoName,
                                             com.jcabi.github.Github github,
                                             java.lang.String pageNumber)
        createRequest creates the HTTPs request to search GitHub. It uses an incrementing pageNumber to create a request for each available page of issues.
        Parameters:
        repoName - the name of the repository to search for issues
        github - the GitHub access object created from getGitHubApi operation
        pageNumber - the page to fetch
        Returns:
        Request object that encapsulates the HTTPs request.
